ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] I need some helper setting the queue-precedence-policy, please!
ygData.msgSnippet: Although we want to offer the possibility to map a sheet of alternate settings to a URI by regex (or any other operator-chosen criteria), right now (2.0.1)

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] I need some helper setting the queue-precedence-policy,
 please!
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=OjXIXUZw70X4HwLwBumTuhOQSznBCiEdVi9Y1xDeArk-
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Although we want to offer the possibility to map a sheet of alternate 
settings to a URI by regex (or any other operator-chosen criteria), 
right now (2.0.1) sheets are only applied based on SURT prefixes.

However, there are at least 2 ways to do what you want:

(1) Write your own UriPrecedencePolicy subclass which examines the URI 
and assigns it a precedence based on your criteria.
(2) Write your own processor (or use a Beanshell script in the 
beanshellProcessor) which pre-assigns a precedence to discovered URIs 
before they are scheduled into the frontier, and make sure whatever URI 
precedence policy is in effect doesn't overwrite it.

In either case, the classes KeyWordProcessors and 
KeyWordUriPrecedencePolicy, as used by one of the Heritrix2 selftests, 
may prove helpful as models. (In particular, KeyWordUriPrecedencePolicy 
just lets any non-zero pre-set URI precedence stand, and only resets an 
unset 0 precedence to the base value... so you could use it with way #2 
above.)

Sorry that the precedence documentation remains thin; I presume you've 
already found the high-level notes at:

http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/Precedence+Feature+Notes

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA

nfoscarini wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I really need some help, because I think I'm stuck in Heritrix 2.0.1.
> 
> I want to crawl a list of seeds, and any URI that contains a keyword I
> want to rank it's queue-precedence value to 1.
> 
> In my global sheet I added a BaseQueuePrecedencePolicy, and set the
> base-precedence value to "5".
> 
> I then created a new sheet called "contacts only", and I changed the
> base-precedence value to "1". I want to apply a rule for URIs that
> have the keyword "contact" to this new base-precedence value. So that
> they are crawled first.
> 
> That's where I'm kind of stuck? How do I apply a filter rule to the
> "contacts only" sheet.
> 
> Is it possible to add a regular expression to the SURTs list for a sheet?
> 
> Can I add a filter or scope rule that is applied to the sheet?
> 
> 
> ------------------------------------
> 
> Yahoo! Groups Links
> 
> 
>
